intro: Ctenitis marginalisora, commonly known as the marginal hawksbeard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk florets. Its leaves are typically basal, with a distinctive lobed or serrated margin. Ctenitis marginalisora thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
